meanings.definition: To fail to keep or retain possession of something.
meanings.sent1: She miskeeps her keys and often can't find them.
meanings.sent2: He miskeeps his promises, making it hard to trust him.
meanings.sent3: The absent-minded professor miskeeps his glasses on top of his head.
meanings.sent4: Time miskeeps memories like fading photographs in an old album.
meanings.sent5: The careless child miskeeps his toys scattered all over the room.

meanings.definition: To neglect or forget to keep something in proper condition or order.
meanings.sent1: The busy gardener miskeeps the plants and they wither away.
meanings.sent2: She miskeeps her room so cluttered that she can't find anything.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful chef miskeeps the recipe and adds salt instead of sugar.
meanings.sent4: Neglecting to oil the hinges, he miskeeps the door from opening smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The lazy student miskeeps his assignments until the last minute.
